root.str: A targeting helmet popularized by a platoon of mercenaries claiming to have never missed a shot.

Thank you for choosing Nascent Expeditions for all your mining and procurement needs! Join us for the final part of our three-part series on construction as we learn about enhancing our fortifications with construction modules.
Contains 5000 Cortium that can replenish used Cortium in structures that require it to operate.
Spawn an ANT from a vehicle terminal.
A light source that infantry can place to brighten their surroundings.
<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> There are also offensive modules that can be used to disrupt enemy bases. So be wary of those who get inside your base intent on inflicting harm.

Modules are specialized attachments for construction objects which improve the construct, enhance its defensive capabilities provide additional functionality.

Unless otherwise noted a module will last until replaced or the object that houses it is destroyed.

Standard Modules
  • Repair Module - Repairs the structure over time and increases its maximum health.
  • Projectile Shield Module - Provides the structure with shielded entryways and windows that infantry can pass through, but not projectiles.
  • Skywall Shield Module - Provides a hardlight umbrella over the structure, preventing projectiles from entering from above.
  • Firewall Module - Prevents other modules in the structure from being overloaded until this module has been disabled. Increases the structure's maximum health.
  • Equipment Terminal Module - Provides the structure with an un-hackable Equipment Terminal.
  • Durability Module - Increases the structure's maximum health.
  • Cortium Capacity Module - Increases the maximum cortium held by the structure.

High Pressure Modules
  • Heavy Repair Module - Rapidly repairs the structure and increases its maximum health. Lasts for a limited time.
  • Fortress Shield Module - Creates a large two-way projectile shield around the structure. Lasts for a limited time.
  • Heat Dispersion Module - Dramatically reduces the turret's heat accumulation while firing and increases its maximum health. Lasts for a limited time.
  • Sensor Sweep - Provides realtime motion tracking information on enemies within a moderate range. Lasts for a limited time.

Attacker Modules
  • Cortium Bomb - Place a bomb in the module socket of an enemy structure. After a short duration the bomb will detonate, heavily damaging the structure it is contained within.
  • Tunnel Worm - When placed in the module slot of an enemy building, it prevents all repairs from taking place until the module is removed or until it burns out. Lasts for a limited time.
Increases the structure's maximum health by 8000.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> A Cortium Silo is the primary reservoir for your collected cortium and acts as the hub of your constructed base. It will consume cortium to power your other construction objects.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Hey your Cortium Silo got destroyed. Go back to your ANT terminal to spawn another one. Reminder if you do not have enough cortium to purchase you will have to harvest cortium again.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Head to the Coritum Silo and purchase a Xiphos Anti-Infantry Phalanx Tower. The tower is specialized in anti-infantry but can also be used for other various means of protecting your base.

Construction objects are assembled using a dense crystalline material known as Cortium. Crackling veins of this valuable ore can be found on all major continents of Auraxis.

Cortium can only be harvested using the specialized lasers mounted on an Advanced Nanite Transport. The ANT is then able to consume the Cortium as a fuel source or transfer its stores to a Cortium Silo where it can be used to create more advanced constructs.
Cannot drop an orbital mining drill at that location
Allows cortium to be used to create a narrow bulwark wall that can be used by infantry units.
Constructs a tunnel structure that can be used by infantry units.
Constructs a tree stand structure that can be used by infantry units.

Soldiers can create new objects with harvested Cortium via a console on either a Cortium Silo or deployed Advanced Nanite Transport. Most objects will first require the purchase of a blueprint before they can be assembled.

Once the blueprint is purchased, construction on the final placeable object can begin by paying the required cost in Cortium. If you are running low on Cortium it may also be possible to bypass the cost through the expenditure of Certification points.
Greetings! We are Nascent Expeditions, the foremost mining and procurement company on and around Auraxis. Join us as we learn about harvesting, in the first of our three-part series on construction!
Purchase and install an Equipment Terminal Module into a socket in the Bunker
Earn this ribbon by installing, overloading, or disarming construction modules.
Repairs the structure by 2% of its maximum health per second, and increases its maximum health by 5000. Lasts for 60 seconds.
Using the Rampart Wall that was created in the previous mission, place the Repair Module into one of the module stands.
Are you sure you want to buy %0?
Modules can be found in the "Modules" tab in the Cortium Silo.
Provides the structure with an un-hackable Equipment Terminal.

Celebrate 20 years of the PlanetSide franchise! This bundle contains cosmetics for all factions, and weapons for VS, NC, and TR. Heroic Boost is granted only to the character that purchases the bundle.
Get back into the ANT and while focusing the Silo hold the "LMB (default)" button to deposit the cortium.
Consume an Orbital Mining Drill asset from the outfit armory and call in an orbital mining drill at this location.
Dramatically reduces the turret's heat accumulation while firing, and increases its maximum health by 2000. Lasts for 60 seconds.
Prevents other modules in the structure from being overloaded until this module has been disabled. Increases the structure's maximum health by 2000.
<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> Return to the terminal on the Cortium Silo and build a Repair Module. All modules can be found in the Modules section of a construction terminal.

The construction system has undergone a major overhaul.

  • Enhance your constructs with new modular upgrades.

  • Personalize your bases with new Shiny things.

  • Collect exciting new blueprints from the Nascent Expeditions vendors in Sanctuary.
Check out the new constructs and modules!

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> There are also offensive modules that can be used to disrupt the enemy faction construction bases. So be wary for enemies who want to do your base any harm.
Place Repair Module into the Rampart Wall
Calls down an Orbital Mining Drill that will periodically expose Cortium Nodes near the marked location. Lasts for 5 minutes. Mining will temporarily cease if enemy forces are nearby.
Constructs an awning structure that can be used by infantry units.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Indicators for cortium nodes will appear while piloting your ANT. Navigate to a nearby node, aim your crosshairs over it, and activate your harvesting laser (LMB by Default).
Allows cortium to be used to create a wide bulwark wall that can be used by infantry units.
The Module Dispenser allows the player to pull modules from this structure.
Authentic Gladiator brand reflex optics offer heat-resistant 2x magnification and includes a holographic red dot sight granting an advantage in urban combat situations.
When placed in the module slot of an enemy building, it prevents all repairs from taking place until the module is removed or until it burns out. Lasts for 60 seconds.
Locate cortium nodes on your HUD and harvest holding your LMB on the node.
Earn this ribbon for capturing and defending control consoles, and for killing enemies around them during a continent Meltdown Alert.
Interact with the construction terminal at the back of the ANT. Unlock the Cortium Silo and place the Silo at an appropriate area.
Use the ANT to harvest Cortium. Deploy the ANT to access the construction terminal on the back of the vehicle. Start building!
Purchase a Xiphos Anti-Infantry Phalanx Tower and Place it in a desired location.
Allows cortium to be used to create a tunnel structure that can be used by infantry units.
Provides a hardlight umbrella over the structure, preventing projectiles from entering from above.

Aim at a location you want the Flail to hit. Must maintain fire for several seconds to establish a target. Each tool is linked to and can only be used to designate targets for the Flail it is pulled from.
<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> Construction begins with tools. Start out by going to a nearby vehicle terminal and spawn an Advanced Nanite Transport, or as we call them, an ANT!

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> With a solid understanding of fortifying our base with walls and turrets, let's move on to further enhancing our structures and turrets through the use of Construction Modules.
In the Cortium Silo "Turrets" tab you are able to find and purchase the Xiphos Anti-Infantry Phalanx Tower.
New and returning franchise anniversary bundles!
Allows cortium to be used to create an awning structure that can be used by infantry units.
Gladiator brand reflex optics offer no magnification but provide a clear red dot sight for close-combat situations.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Defenses are valuable, but sometimes attackers require additional deterrents. Return to your Cortium Silo and build a Xiphos Anti-Infantry Phalanx Turret to further defend your base.
Module Dispenser is out of Cortium
The Fusion Blade boasts an impossibly sharp edge designed for close quarters combat.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Congratulations on completing the first part of our instructional series on construction! Now let's move on to building some of the exciting structures that can be used to fortify a base.
Place the Rampart wall in your desired location.
To deploy an ANT use your "B (default)" key to anchor your ANT.
Applies automated targeting system to constructed turret, allowing it to fire upon enemies while unmanned. Requires a nearby Silo to power the turret. Lasts for 60 seconds.
Cannot drop an orbital mining drill near vehicles, construction objects, or other players.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Exit your vehicle and interact with the terminal at the rear of the ANT. Use the terminal to purchase a Cortium Silo with the cortium you have collected.
Increases the maximum cortium held by the structure by 10,000.

The construction system has undergone numerous additions and enhancements:

  • Added massive new constructs such as the Command Center and Rebirthing Center.
  • Introduced a new Module System to customize most constructs.
  • Replaced open field bases with new Construction Outposts with their own Cortium reserves.
  • And so many more refinements and improvements!

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Congratulations and thank you for participating in this Construction training program for Nascent Expeditions. Auraxis is a big place, but with your help and hard work we can build a brighter future.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> As a reminder you can view the Codex by opening the main menu and looking at the three icons at the bottom right of your screen and the paper icon to the left of the question mark icon is the Codex.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> A Repair Module will slowly repair any damage inflicted upon your Rampart Wall. No engineers or Nano-Armor Kits required!
The NS-D Helios is a fiery weapon that unleashes 5 round bursts. It can be switched to a secondary fire mode that launches a globe of flame at the cost of 50 ammunition.

Thank you for joining us in celebrating twenty years of glorious battle on Auraxis!

To celebrate we're introducing the NS-D Helios. This Heavy Weapon fires searing 5-round bursts, as well as an alternate firing mode which lobs a burning sphere that detonates on impact.

And for a limited time everyone can get in on the action because the NS-D Helios will be available for free by completing the 20-Year Legacy Directive!

Or skip the line and pick up the new PlanetSide 20-Year Legacy Bundle available in the Depot. This bundle includes a cosmetic variant of the Helios, a new "Apex" SMG variant for each faction, a 6-Month Heroic Boost, and an exclusive banner and frame!
Heal teammates or repair their structures, deployables, and vehicles to earn this ribbon.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Hey your ANT got destroyed. Go back to a vehicle terminal to spawn another one. Reminder you will have to harvest cortium again.

<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> The silo must be refueled to maintain power. Return to your ANT and deposit the remaining cortium into the Cortium Silo (LMB by Default). You will need to cancel deployment to move your ANT.
Earn kills during a continent Meltdown Alert.
Repairs the structure by 0.5% of its maximum health per second, and increases its maximum health by 5000.
Place a bomb in the module socket of an enemy structure. After 60 seconds, the bomb will detonate, heavily damaging the structure it is contained within.
Reserve Silos hold up to 25,000 Cortium and offer supplemental storage for the builder of the base. ANTs are required to deposit additional Cortium into a Silo.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Interact with the Equipment Terminal to change out your loadout anytime while under the protection of your bunker.

<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> Safety is always a concern in a warzone, but we can protect ourselves from incoming fire with reinforced walls. Interact with the terminal on your Cortium Silo and build a Rampart Wall.

USE
Pull the targeting marker from a Construction Terminal on a Cortium Silo and place the marker to use.

DESCRIPTION
Requires Reserved Asset permissions.

Calls down an Orbital Mining Drill on the marked location.

Max 2.

Aim at a location you want the Glaive to hit. Must maintain fire for several seconds to establish a target. Each tool is linked to and can only be used to designate targets for the Glaive it is pulled from.
Creates a large two-way projectile shield around the structure. Lasts for 60 seconds.
Constructs a bridge that can be used by infantry and vehicle units.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> You may have noticed that each module indicates what type of structure it can be used with. Place this one in a module stand on your newly constructed Rampart Wall.
With the Rampart Wall schematic equipped you are able to move or rotate to your desire and then place it using the "E" (DEFAULT) key.
Authentic Gladiator brand reflex optics offer heat-resistant 4x magnification and includes a holographic red dot for consistancy across a variety of combat situations.

CONSTRUCTION ALARM TRIGGERED
Enemies detected in the %0 region!

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Once selected, align the arrows so that all green arrows point above the terrain and all blue arrows point beneath the terrain. Place the wall when you are pleased with its position (E key by Default).
Allows cortium to be used to create a bridge that can be used by infantry and vehicle units.
Restocks munitions in the Glaive IPC or Flail as it is consumed. Each shot depletes munitions from this module.
Equipment Terminal is a helpful module for all infantry to use to change your loadout.
Start building a base with a commonly used Bunker to hunker down.
Purchase a Rampart Wall from the Cortium Silo

<font color="#00FFAA">Nalla: </font> Secure your base with more than just a wall. Bunkers are a small fortress for you to hole up in and defend yourself. Return to the Cortium Silo and build a Bunker.
Constructs a large, fortified Command Center with a spawn room, aircraft pad, vehicle pad, and four module sockets.
Provides realtime motion tracking information on enemies within 75 meters. Lasts for 60 seconds.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Now purchase a Repair Module from the silo and place it into one of the two module sockets on the Rampart Wall.
Constructs a secure spawn location with a built-in equipment terminal and two module sockets.
The NS-D Helios is a fiery weapon that unleashes 5 round bursts. It can be switched to a secondary fire mode that launches a globe of flame at the cost of 50 ammunition.
Constructs a narrow bulwark wall that can be used by infantry units.
Construction Item Preview: Visit an ANT or Silo terminal for build access.

Once an object's construction cost has been paid via a console on a Cortium Silo or deployed Advanced Nanite Transport, its creator will enter a placement mode to find a suitable location for the object to be placed onto the battlefield.

The object will be displayed as a hologram that can be rotated and moved around until a suitable placement location is found.

Placement adheres to the following rules:
  • Object must be placed outside of a no-construction zone
  • Objects must have all their green orbs above ground
  • Objects must have all their blue orbs below ground
  • Objects of similar types cannot be placed within proximity of each other

The hologram will appear in red until a suitable placement location is found and become green upon finding such a location. Once a suitable location is found the object can be placed by using the Interact key (default: E).

All objects placed within range of a Cortium Silo draw on power from that silo to function. If that Silo is destroyed or if the object is placed outside of the range of a silo, then the object may cease to provide benefits and will begin to decay over time.

Allows cortium, at the normal cost, to be used to create various modules for players to slot into sockets attached to structures. Once cortium is drained from the dispenser, it will replenish its cortium from the nearby silo.
Go into the Cortium Silo terminal to purchase a Rampart Wall.
Authentic Gladiator brand reflex optics offer heat-resistant 3.4x magnification and includes a holographic red dot sight offering versatility for all combat situations.
Insufficient permissions or war asset unavailable.
Purchase a Repair Module from the Cortium Silo
Constructs a banner displaying your Outfit icon.
Thank you for choosing Nascent Expeditions for all your mining and procurement needs! Join us as we learn about building fortifications in the second of our three-part series on construction.

<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Great! Now you know some of the basic fortifications that Construction can provide. If you want to explore more about Structures and Turrets you may go back to the Silo or the Codex entries in the main menu.
Constructs a wide bulwark wall that can be used by infantry units.
Unlock items with Certs or DBC, then use Certs or Cortium to build with unlocked items.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Your ANT can deploy to reveal a construction terminal. Deploy your ANT now (B key by Default).
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> Hi there. I'm Nalla of Nascent Expeditions. And I'm here to teach you everything you need to know about construction.
Allows cortium to be used to create a tree stand structure that can be used by infantry units.
Provides the structure with shielded entryways and windows that infantry can pass through, but not projectiles.
<font color="#00FFAA">Representative Nalla: </font> To make your bunker extra special let's install an Equipment Terminal module. Bunkers come with two module stands to reinforce the building.
Modified Blast Wall to now allow infantry traversal. Once fully constructed can withstand a moderate amount of damage.
